title: Simplify the Expression
text: To isolate the variable, first divide both sides by $$3$$ to get $${\left(x-4\right)}^2=5$$.
speech: To isolate the variable, first divide both sides by  3  to get , parentheses x minus 4,  squared is equal to 5 .
pacedSpeech: To isolate the variable, first divide both sides by   3
to get  ,  x minus 4,  squared is equal to 5

title: Square Root
text: Take the +/- square root of both sides: $$x-4=\pm \sqrt{5}$$.
speech: Take the +/- square root of both sides:  x minus 4, is equal to, plus or minus, the square root of 5 .
pacedSpeech: Take the +/- square root of both sides:   x minus 4, is equal to, plus or minus, the square root of 5

title: Isolating $$x$$
text: Add $$4$$ to both sides of the equation: $$x=\pm \sqrt{5}+4$$. This is our final answer.
speech: Add  4  to both sides of the equation:  x, is equal to, plus or minus, the square root of 5 plus 4 . This is our final answer.
pacedSpeech: to both sides of the equation:   x, is equal to, plus or minus, the square root of 5 plus 4
